texts: A single coffee tree yields only about 1-2 pounds of roasted coffee per year — you'd need roughly 25-30 trees just to make your daily cup.
Sweden banned coffee three times between 1756 and 1819, with physicians claiming it poisoned the blood and shortened lives.
Coffee plants can live and produce cherries for 20-30 years, but they won't grow their first fruit until they're at least 3 years old.
